intro: Lissochilus keilianus, commonly known as the Keilian's beard tongue, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine habitats. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
